text: Leonardo Olivera (born 8 June 1987) is a Chilean footballer who now plays for C.D. Cobresal in his home country.Los 162 fichajes que encendieron el mercado CDF.CL ==Career== Olivera started his senior career with Unión Quilpué. In 2010, he signed for C.D. Cobreloa in the Chilean Primera División, where he made five appearances and scored zero goals.at Soccerway After that, he played for Vasalunds IF, San Luis de Quillota, Unión San Felipe, CD Magallanes, Deportes Iberia, Sitra Club, Curicó Unido, San Marcos de Arica, Deportes Valdivia, and Deportes Melipilla. == References == == External links == * The story of the lone striker who became the first Chilean to play in Bahrain * The story of Olivera, the only Chilean who played in Bahrain * El Pachuca was tempted with a goalscorer from Tercera * The exotic destinations of national footballers that almost no one remembers Category:Living people Category:1987 births Category:Chilean footballers Category:Chilean expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Sweden Category:Expatriate footballers in Bahrain Category:Naval de Talcahuano footballers Category:Cobreloa footballers Category:Vasalunds IF players Category:San Luis de Quillota footballers Category:Unión San Felipe footballers Category:Magallanes footballers Category:Deportes Iberia footballers Category:Curicó Unido footballers Category:San Marcos de Arica footballers Category:Deportes Valdivia footballers Category:Deportes Melipilla footballers Category:Cobresal footballers Category:Association football forwards
title: Leonardo Olivera
